HologramLib.title: HologramLib
HologramLib.meta_description: Minecraft hologram library with text, item & block displays, leaderboards, and extensive customization. packet-based, modern & easy to use
HologramLib.description: A powerful **<gradient>packet-based</gradient>** text display hologram library for Minecraft servers with MiniMessage support, emoji rendering, and extensive customization options.

content.content:
**HologramLib** is a display entity-based hologram library for modern Minecraft servers (**1.19.4** to **1.21.5**).
It allows developers to create dynamic, customizable holograms using packets, with support for MiniMessage formatting, animations, and per-player visibility.

It works with Paper, Purpur, Spigot, and Folia servers, and requires PacketEvents as a dependency.
It __does not__ support **Bedrock** or older Minecraft versions (~~1.8 to 1.19.3~~).

**The library supports multiple hologram types:**
· Text with styling, scaling, background colors
· Blocks and Items displayed as holograms
· Leaderboards with live updates

**Advanced features include:**
· Animation support
· Entity attachment (e.g. hologram on a mob)
· View distance control
· Per-player visibility and interactivity (planned)

Integration is simple with a [JitPack](https://jitpack.io/#HologramLib/HologramLib) dependency and a few lines of code. Full usage examples are provided in the [Wiki](https://github.com/maximjsx/HologramLib/wiki)

items: Custom emoji and Unicode character support

content.title: Server Highlights
items: Custom plugin infrastructure built from scratch

content.content: **Notable Collaborations:** The server attracted attention from major Minecraft content creators including [Copeat](https://www.twitch.tv/copeat), [Brostastic](https://www.youtube.com/@BrostasticTV), and [SimplyFuse](https://www.twitch.tv/simplyfuse). We also had the honor of hosting special guests such as [GommeHD](https://www.youtube.com/user/GommeHD), [Wichtiger](https://www.youtube.com/wichtiger), [Fuxelbau](https://www.twitch.tv/fuxelbau), and even a Mojang employee, showcasing the server's reputation in the community.

posts.title: The end?
posts.excerpt: For now, further development of the network has been paused

content.content: **Legacy:** While NextFight Network concluded operations in 2024, it remains a testament to innovative Minecraft server development and successful community management. The technical solutions and creative approaches developed for NextFight continue to influence my current projects.

aboutMe.title: About Me
aboutMe.content: I’m a Software Engineer with 1.5 years of hands-on experience designing, architecting, and deploying scalable, high-performance web applications. I specialize in building seamless user experiences using modern JavaScript frameworks like React.js and Next.js, and crafting robust backend solutions with Node.js, GraphQL, and Express. My backend expertise includes working with relational and NoSQL databases such as PostgreSQL and MongoDB, using tools like Prisma ORM to manage data efficiently. I’m proficient in TypeScript, Python, and SQL, and well-versed in RESTful and GraphQL API architectures. In addition to development, I’m experienced in setting up CI/CD workflows, writing automated tests with Jest and Cypress, and ensuring applications are production-ready through performance tuning, Lighthouse optimization, and secure deployment practices. I thrive in Agile environments, enjoy collaborating with cross-functional teams, and have a proven track record of improving code quality, accelerating feature delivery, and solving real-world user problems. I’m passionate about clean code, scalable architecture, and always learning the next best tool or technology.

content.introduction: This portfolio website is designed with minimal data collection and maximum user privacy in mind.

sections.title: Information Collection
sections.description: We collect the following types of information:
details: Name, email, and message content submitted through the contact form
IP address for rate limiting and security purposes
Potential tracking of client-side interactions for website functionality

sections.title: Data Processing and Storage
details: Contact form submissions are processed in-memory and not permanently stored
IP addresses are temporarily tracked for rate limiting (maximum 30 minutes)
No persistent user data is saved or stored long-term

sections.title: Third-Party Services
sections.description: Potential data collection by third-party services:
details: Image hosting services (e.g., shields.io) may collect IP address during image requests
Standard browser and server logs may capture additional metadata

sections.title: Data Protection
sections.description: We implement the following protection measures:
details: Rate limiting to prevent abuse of contact form
No storage of sensitive personal information

sections.title: User Rights
details: Request deletion of any potential stored information
